class.name: Shifter
proficiency: and your choice of Dexterity or Constitution

default: (a) a {@item shortbow|Ishiir} and a {@item quiver|phb} of 20 arrows or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item club|Ishiir} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
An {@item explorer's pack|phb}, and four {@item dagger|Ishiir|daggers}

classFeature.name: Formshift
entries: By choice or circumstance, you possess the ability to shift into an animal-like form that outfits you with heightened senses, swiftness, and primal ferocity in battle. You shift forms as a bonus action.
While shifted, you gain the following benefits as long as you aren't wearing armor heavier than light or a shield:

items: You have advantage on perception checks.
Your speed is doubled.
When you make a melee weapon attack with your natural weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll. This bonus increases as you level.

entries: If you are able to cast spells, you can't cast them or concentrate on them while shifted.
Your formshift lasts for an amount of hours equal to your shifter level. It ends early if you fall {@condition unconscious|Ishiir}. You can also end your formshift as a bonus action.

Once you have shifted the maximum number of times for your shifter level, you must finish a long rest before you can shift again. You may shift 2 times at 1st level, 3 at 3rd, 4 at 6th, 5 at 12th, and 6 at 17th.

You choose whether your equipment falls to the ground in your space, merges into your shifted form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal, but the DM decides whether it is practical for your shifted form to wear a piece of equipment, based on your shape and size. Your equipment doesn't change size or shape to match the new form, and any equipment that your shifted form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge with it. Equipment that merges with your shifted form has no effect until you leave Formshift.

classFeature.name: Natural Weapons
entries: Even when not shifted, your form is permanently altered to include fangs, claws, or talons. When you make a melee weapon attack with these natural weapons, you roll a {@dice d6} and add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the attack and damage roll (your choice).
This die changes as you gain shifter levels, as shown in the Natural Weapons column of the Shifter table.

classFeature.name: Wild Aspect
entries: At 1st level, you choose the shape of your formshift. Your choice grants you features at 1st, 7th, 13th, and 18th levels.

classFeature.name: Primal Defence
entries: Beginning at 2nd level, your animal-like swiftness or thick skin makes it more difficult to land a hit on you.
While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice when you get this feature) and your Constitution modifier.

classFeature.name: Animal Senses
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency in {@skill Perception}. If you are already proficient in the skill, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any skill check made with it.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Martial Mastery
entries: Starting at 4th level, you gain the mastery benefits for two {@filter weapons|items|source=ishiir|type=|category=|homebrew mastery=!none;!light;!medium;!heavy} of your choice as well as an {@filter armor|items|source=ishiir|type=|category=|homebrew mastery=!none;light;medium;heavy} type (see {@variantrule Armor Mastery|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Weapon Mastery|Ishiir} variant rules). You must be proficient in the chosen weapons and armor. If you possess the Unarmored Defense feature, you may {@optfeature Unarmored Defense|Ishiir|choose it} in place of an armor type.
You can change your choices when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Primal Strikes
entries: Starting at 6th level, your natural weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

classFeature.name: Wild Aspect Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain one feature granted by your Wild Aspect.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Starting at 9th level, when an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

classFeature.name: Wild Stride
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can use the {@action Dash|Ishiir} action as a bonus action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Greater Formshift
entries: At 11th level, your size changes to large when you use your Formshift class feature and the damage dice for attacks using your natural weapons are doubled.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Wild Aspect Feature
entries: At 13th level, you gain one feature granted by your Wild Aspect.

classFeature.name: Ferocious Critical
entries: At 14th level, you can roll two additional weapon damage dice when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with an attack using your natural weapons.

classFeature.name: Persistent Formshift
entries: At 15th level, you can remain shifted for an indefinite amount of time. You can still end your Formshift as usual.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Wild Blessing
entries: At 17th level, choose two ability scores from Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution. The chosen ability scores and their maximums increase by 2.

classFeature.name: Wild Aspect Feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain one feature granted by your Wild Aspect.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Primal Avatar
entries: When you reach 20th level, you gain the following benefits while shifted:

items: Your size increases to huge and your damage dice for attacks with your natural weapons are tripled.

You can't be {@condition charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition frightened|Ishiir}. If you are {@condition charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition frightened|Ishiir} when you use Formshift, the effect is suspended for the duration of the shift.
At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier if you have no more than half of your hit points left.

subclassFeature.name: Winged Aspect
entries: At 1st level, you adopt an avian aspect, granting you physical traits such as the piercing eyes of a bird of prey, sharp nails, and wings sprouting from your back.
You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed. If you are not shifted, you have to end your flying movement on the ground.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Winged Aspect
entries: At 7th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

items: You gain a {@sense darkvision} range of 120 feet. If you already possess {@sense darkvision}, add 120 ft to its range.
Your speed increases by 10 feet and you do not provoke opportunity attacks when you fly out of an enemy's reach.

If you move at a downwards angle for at least 20 ft in a straight line before making a melee attack with your natural weapons, you can add 1 point of damage for every 5 ft travelled in this manner to the damage roll of that attack and force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is knocked {@condition prone|Ishiir}. The DC for this is 8 + your proficiency + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Strong Wings
entries: Beginning at 13th level, you no longer need to end your flying movement on the ground while not shifted.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Winged Aspect
entries: At 18th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

items: While flying, you can hide as a bonus action and your wings cause no sound when you move while flying.

When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

Your critical range with your natural weapons increases by 1. When you critically hit a creature it has to make a Constitutions saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition dazed|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn. The DC for this is 8 + your proficiency + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Clawed Aspect
entries: At 1st level, you adopt a feline aspect, granting you physical traits such as the vertical pupils, sharp nails, and elongated canines.
You gain a {@sense darkvision} range of 60 feet. If you already possess {@sense darkvision}, add 60 ft to its range.

Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with your natural weapons, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition lacerated|Ishiir}. The DC for this is 8 + your proficiency + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Creatures who cannot bleed are immune to this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Clawed Aspect
entries: At 7th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill. If you are already proficient, you double your proficiency bonus for all checks made with this skill. You have advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are surprised.
You gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed and when you take fall damage, you can use your reaction to decrease that damage by an amount equal to five times your Shifter level.

When you make an attack with your natural weapons against a creature that is {@condition prone|Ishiir} or {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}, you can use your bonus action to attempt to {@condition grappled|Ishiir|grapple} the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Sharp Claws
entries: Beginning at 13th level, when you inflict the {@condition lacerated|Ishiir} condition on a creature using your Clawed Aspect feature, the damage the creature takes is equal to thrice your proficiency modifier, rather than twice.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Clawed Aspect
entries: At 18th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

items: If you attack a creature that you are hidden from, all your attacks that turn deal an additional {@damage 1d12} damage. If the target creature is also surprised, that damage increases to {@damage 2d12}.
On your turn, you can use your bonus action to give yourself a +2 bonus to your AC.

When you make an attack with your natural weapons against a creature that is {@condition prone|Ishiir}, {@condition grappled|Ishiir} by you, or {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}, you can add +5 to the attack's damage.

subclassFeature.name: Fanged Aspect
entries: At 1st level, you adopt a canine aspect, granting you physical traits such as the piercing eyes, sharp nails, and elongated canines.
You gain a {@sense darkvision} range of 60 feet. If you already possess {@sense darkvision}, add 60 ft to its range.

Once per turn when you hit a creature with your natural weapons, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is knocked {@condition prone|Ishiir}. The DC for this is 8 + your proficiency + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). If the target creature is already {@condition prone|Ishiir}, you can attempt to {@condition grappled|Ishiir|grapple} it instead, using the usual skill check instead of forcing a saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Fanged Aspect
entries: At 7th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

items: You have advantage on attack rolls with your natural weapons against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}.

You can take the {@action Help|Ishiir} action as a bonus action. You can always use the {@action Help|Ishiir} action to give someone advantage on a skill check, even if you are not proficient in the relevant skill yourself.
If you knock a creature {@condition prone|Ishiir} with your Fanged Aspect feature, that creature's speed is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Tenacious Fangs
entries: Beginning at 13th level, creatures have disadvantage on skill checks to avoid being {@condition grappled|Ishiir} by you if they are {@condition prone|Ishiir} and disadvantage on skill checks to escape your {@condition grappled|Ishiir|grapple}.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Fanged Aspect
entries: At 18th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

items: When a creature within 5 ft of you is hit by a melee attack from one of your allies, you can use your reaction to immediately force that creature to make a Strength saving throw as per your Fanged Aspect feature.

You gain a bonus to all saving throws equal to the number of allied creatures within 30 ft of you. You do not gain this bonus for an ally that is {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir} or {@condition dominated|Ishiir}.
When you fail a Strength or Constitution saving throw, you can use your reaction to reroll it, taking either result.
